'Booz Allen Hamilton Inc.' (informally: 'Booz Allen' ) is an American
technology consulting firm headquartered in Tysons Corner, Fairfax County,
Virginia in Greater Washington DC, with 80 other offices throughout the United
States. Its core business is the provision of management, technology and
security services, primarily to civilian government agencies and as a security
and defense contractor to defense and intelligence agencies, as well
as civil and commercial services. The scope of services includes
strategic planning, human capital and learning, communications, operational
improvement, information technology work, systems engineering, organizational
change efforts, modeling and simulation, program management, assurance and
resilience, and economic business analysis.

Booz Allen Hamilton was founded in 1914 by Edwin G. Booz, and is one of the
oldest management consulting firms in the world. As of 2013, 99% of the
company's revenue comes from the Federal government. {{cite news |url=http://money.cnn.com/2013/06/10/news/booz-allen-hamilton-
leak/index.html |title=Booz Allen Hamilton in spotlight over leak |first=Charles
|last=Riley |publisher=CNN |date=June 10, 2013}} {{cite news |url=
|title=How cash secretly rules surveillance policy: Today's congressional
hearing was a joke. The reason: Firms like Booz Allen bankroll and own Congress.
Here's how |publisher=Salon |first=David |last=Sirota |date=June 18,
2013}} It has been ranked by Vault from 11th to 4th best consulting
company worldwide on a number of criteria, including prestige and quality
(2012), {{cite web |url=http://web.archive.org/web/20111006030407/http://ww-
w.vault.com/wps/portal/usa/rankings/individual?rankingId1=143&rankingId2=143&ra-
nkings=1&regionId=0&rankingYear=2012 |title=Tech Consulting Firm Rankings 2012:
Vault IT Consulting 25 |publisher=Vault.com |date=April 30, 2012}} the 9th
best consulting firms to work for by Consulting Magazine (2011) {{cite web
|url=http://www.consultingmag.com/article/ART852138?C=RooxwkyeqLSv769 |title=The
2011 Best Firms to Work For |publisher=consultingmag.com |date= August 22, 2011
}} and the 16th in its listing of industry leaders in the government
sector by Bloomberg Government (2012, based on 2011 data). {{cite web |url=http://about.bgov.com/2012/06/14/special-event-bgov200-federal-industry-
leaders-event/ |title=BGOV 200 Federal Industry Leaders|publisher=BGOV.com
|accessdate=May 12, 2013}}

As of August 2008, Booz Allen Hamiltonâs former parent company (which used the
Booz Allen name itself) divided in two. The Booz Allen Hamilton moniker was
retained by the half focusing on U.S. governmental matters, with Booz & Company
taking sole control of its commercial strategy and international portfolio. Booz
Allen Hamilton is majority owned by private equity firm The Carlyle Group, while
Booz & Company is owned and operated as a partnership. [http://www.boozallen.com/news/39856120?o9002123=&lpid=66005
Booz Allen separate]. Boozallen.com (May 16, 2008). Retrieved on June 25,
2013. On November 17, 2010, Booz Allen's shares of common stock began
trading at the New York Stock Exchange.

In June 2013 when Booz Allen employee Edward Snowden made the 2013 mass
surveillance disclosures including Booz Allen's support in developing the NSA's
classified mass surveillance and data collection program PRISM, Booz Allen
condemned Snowden's actions as "shocking" and "a grave violation of the code of
conduct and core values of our firm" and fired him. * * * The United States Air Force issued a statement that
Booz Allen did nothing wrong and may continue its business with the
government. * *
